Lack enough support: The claim lacks evidence or support that Amy Coney Barrett made the statement about breastfeeding babies being child molestation.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence or statement from Barrett supporting the claim.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by attributing a false statement to Barrett without any basis.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on an anonymous post on Reddit as the source of the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Barrett holds extreme views on breastfeeding without any evidence or statements to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim can be explained by the fact that false attacks and fake quotes are being spread about Barrett during her confirmation process.
